to be CEO, Eric Schmidt said during the call. "It's time for him to have a shot at running this." Page hailed Eric Schmidt as a "tremendous leader" whose contributions exceeded all expectations. There is really no one else in the universe that could have accomplished what Eric Schmidt has done, Page said. Although he tried to debunk the idea in Thursday's interview, Eric Schmidt may have been growing weary of all the attention and prosaic duties that come with running one of world's most scrutinized companies.

Page praised Eric Schmidt , too. "There is no other CEO in the world that could have kept such headstrong founders so deeply involved and still run the business so brilliantly," he said. Eric Schmidt is a tremendous leader and I have learned innumerable lessons from him. The holiday period saw a jump in online commerce, which benefited Google Inc. as the majority of its revenue comes from search advertising. Google Inc. says co-founder Larry Page will return as CEO on April 4,

MVP and four-time scoring champion plans to play in his 11th straight All-Star game Feb. 14 at Cowboys Stadium. "My fans still support me. You can't ask for more than that," he said. When you play this game, it's all about the people that come to see you, the people in the stands. For somebody to say the fans don't mean anything, that's crazy. Since joining the team in early December, Allen Iverson has helped the 76ers go 10-13 after a 5-15 start. He entered Saturday averaging 14.2 points, well below his career average, and 4.3 assists.
